abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Rapid
            Response Program for Malawi is to support: (i) achieving and
            maintaining macroeconomic stability and restoring the
            functioning of a market-based economy to ensure a quick
            growth rebound and (ii) protecting the poor and most
            vulnerable groups in the short run while improving
            transparency of delivery systems. This Rapid Response
            Program paper seeks approval of the Executive Directors to
            provide International Development Association (IDA) grant
            and credit in the amount of SDR 99.6 million (US$150 million
            equivalent) to the Republic of Malawi in support of its
            reform program. The program responds to an urgent request by
            the Government of Malawi (GoM) to support the ongoing
            macroeconomic stabilization program as well as measures
            which will mitigate the impacts of the wide range of reforms
            which are being currently implemented. Some of the key
            economic reforms include liberalizing Malawi's foreign
            exchange regime and significant fuel and power price
            adjustments to better cover costs of these essential
            commodities. The program is aligned with the ongoing Country
            Assistance Strategy (CAS) and is also consistent with new
            World Bank Group CAS for Malawi (FY13-16) which is at an
            advanced stage of preparation. This document comprises an
            overview, which provides the context, rationale, and
            description of the program.
